meanings.definition: To cause suffering or harm on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The bully inflicted pain on the smaller kids.
meanings.sent2: The storm inflicted damage on the houses in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat inflicted chaos by knocking over the flower pots.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words inflicted wounds on her heart.
meanings.sent5: The virus inflicted a heavy toll on the population.

meanings.definition: To impose something unwelcome or harmful on someone.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher inflicted extra homework on the students.
meanings.sent2: The prankster inflicted embarrassment on his friend by revealing a secret.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain inflicted a soggy surprise on the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The new policy inflicted confusion on the employees.
meanings.sent5: The noisy neighbors inflicted sleepless nights on the residents.

meanings.definition: To bring about or impose something unpleasant or harmful on oneself.
meanings.sent1: She inflicted unnecessary stress on herself by worrying too much.
meanings.sent2: He inflicted a headache on himself by staying up too late.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef inflicted a burnt dinner on himself.
meanings.sent4: The procrastinator inflicted a last-minute rush on himself.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil inflicted injuries on himself with his risky stunts.
